Cf. {{HM|Guide}}, entry '''Wolf-riders''', p. 429.</ref>}}

'''Wolf-riders''',<ref name=riders/><ref name=deep>{{TT|Deep}}, p. 529</ref><ref name=road>{{TT|Road}}, p. 551</ref><ref name=battle>{{H|Burst}}</ref> or '''wolfriders''',<ref name=isen>{{UT|Isen}}</ref> were groups of "[[Orcs]] or Orclike beings" that rode on [[wolves]].<ref name=index>{{UT|Index}}, entry ''Wolfriders''</ref>

== History ==
[[Orcs]] used [[wolves]] as steeds during the [[First Age]].<ref name=first>{{S|Beren}}</ref> Wolfriders partook in the [[Battle of Unnumbered Tears]] alongside wolves and [[Dragons]].<ref name=jewels>{{GA|230}}</ref><ref>{{S|Fifth}}</ref>

During the [[Third Age]], there were alliances that were made between the [[Wargs]] in the [[Vales of Anduin]] and the [[Orcs of the Misty Mountains]] against the [[Woodmen]]. The Orcs sometimes rode on wolves.<ref name=alliance>{{H|Pan}}</ref> During the [[Battle of Five Armies]], the swiftest wolf-riders were used by the Orcs and Wargs as a vanguard to attack [[Dale]], where they killed many [[Dwarves]] and [[Lake-men]] before being defeated on the eastern slopes of the [[Lonely Mountain]].<ref name=battle/>

During the [[War of the Ring]], [[Saruman]] employed Wolf-riders alongside Orcs and [[:Category:Evil|evil]] [[Men]] to harass [[Rohan]].<ref name=riders/> These Wolf-riders<ref name=riders/> were mostly used in tracking fugitives or destroying isolated groups.<ref name=fords>{{UT|11a}}, note 5</ref>

On [[25 February]], "a great pack of the dreaded Orcish wolfriders" were part of the vanguard of the eastern force that Saruman had sent to slay [[Théodred]] during the [[First Battle of the Fords of Isen]].<ref name=isen/> These wolfriders<ref name=isen/> were "feared by [[horses]]"<ref name=isen/> as they passed through gaps between horsemen and slashed at the bellies of the horses.<ref name=fords/> After Théodred's death,<ref name=isen/> two wolfriders were reported by [[Elfhelm]]'s outriders, causing him to ride to the [[Fords of Isen]] instead of to the [[Hornburg]] at [[Helm's Deep]].<ref name=isen/>

On [[2 March]], "several troops of the dreaded wolfriders" were sent along the eastern bank of the [[Isen]] as forerunners to the main division of Saruman's forces. These wolfriders tried to attack Elfhelm's companies and prevent him from reinforcing [[Grimbold]].<ref name=isen/>

After the [[Second Battle of the Fords of Isen]], it was reported by a swift scout "that wolf-riders were abroad in the [[Westfold Vale|valley]]" about [[Helm's Deep]].<ref name=deep/>

[[Gandalf]] had sent Elfhelm "with many Riders to [[Edoras]]" because he was afraid of "wolf-riders and plunderers" riding to [[Meduseld]] when no-one was there to defend it.<ref name=road/>

== Other versions of the legendarium ==
In the early version of the [[legendarium]] in ''[[The Book of Lost Tales]]'', [[Beren]] slew many "wolf-rider Orcs"<ref name=notes>{{LT2|In}}, p. 67</ref> during his adventures prior to entering [[Doriath]].<ref name=tinuviel>{{LT2|I}}, p. 44</ref>

In an early version of the [[Battle of Tumhalad]] in the tale of "[[Turambar and the Foalókë]]", some of the Orcs in [[Glaurung|Glorund]]'s army were "mounted upon wolves".<ref name=turambar>{{LT2|II}}, p. 84</ref>

In the immediate aftermath of the [[Fall of Gondolin]] in the [[The Fall of Gondolin (chapter)|first version]] of the tale, [[Eärendel]] and six of the [[Exiles of Gondolin]] were chased by a score of wolfriders in [[Tumladin]] before being rescued by [[Tuor]] and the [[folk of the Wing]]. Two of the wolfriders escaped. After going through the [[Echoriad|Encircling Mountains]], the Exiles of Gondolin became fearful of encountering any wolfriders.<ref name=tales>{{LT2|III}}, pp. 190, 195</ref>

After the [[Battle of Unnumbered Tears]] in ''[[The Lay of the Children of Húrin]]'', wolfriders roamed freely alongside "wandering [[Orcs]] and the [[Things of Morgoth]]" throughout [[Beleriand]].<ref name=roaming>{{LB|1b}}, pp. 10, 110,</ref>

After the fall of [[Dor-Cúarthol]] in ''[[The Lay of the Children of Húrin]]'', wolf-riders were among the Orcs and Wolves that took [[Túrin]] captive.<ref name=beleg>{{LB|1c}}, p. 40</ref>

In a very early draft of ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]'', [[Treebeard]] took [[Meriadoc Brandybuck]] and [[Peregrin Took]] across Rohan to [[Minas Tirith]], but after smelling some war, they all witnessed "a battle of '''Wolfriders''' (Saruman) and the [[Rohirrim|Horsemasters]]" on the way.<ref name=early>{{TI|Treebeard}}, p. 412</ref> It is very likely that this battle was the earliest version of the [[Battles of the Fords of Isen]] since those are the only battles in ''The Lord of the Rings'' in which Wolf-riders<ref name=riders/> fight against the Rohirrim.

In an early draft of the chapter "[[The Road to Isengard]]", Gandalf's fear of "wolf-riders and plunderers"<ref name=road/> riding to Meduseld was originally a fear of "wolf-riders and cruel plunderers" being "sent swiftly" to the [[Golden Hall]].<ref name=cruel>{{WR|III}}, p. 29</ref>

In an early draft of the chapter "[[Flotsam and Jetsam]]", Merry reported that Saruman emptied Isengard of all his remaining forces, which included groups of Orcs "mounted on great wolves" and regiments of [[Dunlanders]].<ref name=forces>{{WR|IV}}, p. 51</ref> He also saw the [[Ents]] deal "with a pack of wolf-riders" that were escorting [[Gríma]] into [[Isengard]].<ref name=isengard>{{WR|IV}}, p. 54</ref>

'''2002: ''[[The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers]]'':'''
:Saruman refers to the pack of Wolf-riders under the command of [[Sharku]] as '''Warg-riders''' and sends them to attack the Rohan refugees of Edoras on their way to Helm's Deep. During the skirmish with Warg-riders, [[Aragorn]] falls from a cliff, and is later found by [[Brego (horse)|Brego]].

'''2003: ''[[The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King]]'':'''
:The Orc lieutenant [[Gothmog]] rides a Warg during one scene. Two Warg-riders are seen riding alongside the [[Easterlings]] after the [[Olog-hai]] breach the [[Great Gate of Minas Tirith]].

'''2006: ''[[The Lord of the Rings: The Battle for Middle-earth II]]'':'''
:In the expansion ''[[The Lord of the Rings: The Battle for Middle-earth II: The Rise of the Witch-king|The Rise of the Witch-king]]'', Thrall Masters can summon [[Gundabad]] Wolf-Riders.

'''2012-14: [[The Hobbit (film series)|''The Hobbit'' (film series)]]:'''
:In the film trilogy, [[Azog]] and [[Bolg]], as well as many orcs under their command, are shown to ride Wargs as they pursue [[Thorin and Company]], and later take part in the Battle of the Five Armies.
